back_cards.definition_en: In a truthful or sincere manner
back_cards.example_en: She honestly admitted her mistake during the meeting.
Honestly, I have no idea where I parked my car.
He spoke honestly about his struggles with the project.
I honestly feel this is the best decision for us.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that shows integrity
back_cards.example_en: She honestly answered all the questions during the interview.

back_cards.definition_en: To pursue in order to catch
back_cards.example_en: The dog loves to chase squirrels in the park.
She had to chase the bus after missing it by seconds.

back_cards.definition_en: To seek or pursue a goal
back_cards.example_en: He’s been chasing his dream of becoming a musician for years.

back_cards.definition_en: To try to obtain something competitive
back_cards.example_en: Companies chase profits by cutting costs.

back_cards.definition_en: To go after with intent to engage
back_cards.example_en: The police chased the suspect through the alley.

back_cards.definition_en: To exhale loudly expressing relief or frustration
back_cards.example_en: She sighed with relief when the exam was over.
He sighed when he heard the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: To make a sound showing exhaustion
back_cards.example_en: After a long day, she sighed and collapsed on the couch.
He sighed as he watched the sunset, missing home.
The student sighed during the long lecture.
She assured her boss the report would be ready by tomorrow.
He assured his friend that everything would be okay.
The doctor assured her the treatment was safe.
They assured delivery of the package by evening.

back_cards.definition_en: To reassure in a comforting way
back_cards.example_en: She assured her child there were no monsters under the bed.

back_cards.definition_en: A service like electricity or water
back_cards.example_en: The storm caused a disruption in the city’s utility services.
The new tool’s utility made the job much easier.
The utility company raised its rates this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A feature that serves a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The app’s utility lies in its simple design.
Water is a vital utility for every household.
His aggressive tone made the meeting tense.
The team played an aggressive game to win the championship.
The aggressive dog barked at strangers.
She took an aggressive approach to solving the problem.
The aggressive marketing campaign boosted sales.
She baked chocolate chip cookies for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A treat given as a reward
back_cards.example_en: The teacher gave each student a cookie for good behavior.

back_cards.definition_en: A small data file on a computer
back_cards.example_en: The website uses cookies to track user preferences.
Grandma’s cookies are always the best.

back_cards.definition_en: A snack shared in social settings
back_cards.example_en: They passed around cookies during the coffee break.
The loud noise filled her with terror.
He felt terror when he got lost in the forest.
The news reported a terror attack in the city.
The horror movie filled the audience with terror.

back_cards.definition_en: A person or thing causing fear
back_cards.example_en: The storm was a terror, destroying homes.

back_cards.definition_en: Having a lot of money or assets
back_cards.example_en: The wealthy businessman donated to charity.
The region is wealthy in natural resources.
She admired the wealthy family’s grand mansion.
The book offers a wealthy collection of stories.
The wealthy neighborhood had large, elegant homes.
She updated her resume before applying for the job.
He updated the team on the project’s progress.
The company updated its software for better performance.
She updated her blog with new travel stories.
He updated his parents about his new job.
She joined a forum to discuss gardening tips.
The town held a forum to address local issues.
The conference was a forum for young scientists.
The newspaper’s forum page published reader opinions.
The coding forum helped her solve a bug.
The countries formed an alliance for mutual defense.

back_cards.definition_en: A partnership for a common goal
back_cards.example_en: The companies created an alliance to share resources.
The alliance between the teams led to success.
The political alliance aimed to win the election.

back_cards.definition_en: A collaboration in business or politics
back_cards.example_en: The alliance with the supplier lowered costs.
She possesses a rare collection of coins.

back_cards.definition_en: To have as a quality or skill
back_cards.example_en: He possesses great talent in painting.
A strange fear possessed her during the storm.
They possess the ability to solve complex problems.
The family possesses a large farm in the countryside.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of countries under one ruler
back_cards.example_en: The Roman Empire ruled vast territories.
She built a media empire from scratch.

back_cards.definition_en: A domain of influence or control
back_cards.example_en: His empire of restaurants spanned the city.
The empire collapsed after centuries of rule.
The tech empire dominated the industry.
The curious child asked endless questions.
She was curious about the new neighbor.
The book had a curious plot twist.
His curious mind led to many discoveries.
The curious tourist wandered off the main path.

back_cards.definition_en: A grain crop, also called maize
back_cards.example_en: The farmer grew corn in the fields.

back_cards.definition_en: A staple food in many cultures
back_cards.example_en: She made corn tortillas for dinner.
The recipe called for a can of corn.
Corn is a major crop in the Midwest.
The cattle were fed corn from the silo.
She calculated the total cost of the trip.
He calculated the time needed to finish the task.
The move was calculated to gain an advantage.
The software calculates taxes automatically.
She calculated the risks before investing.
She hurried to catch the morning train.
He hurried through his homework to play outside.
They hurried to finish the project by the deadline.
She hurried to help her friend in need.
He hurried across the street to avoid the rain.
She teaches at an elementary school.
The book explains elementary math concepts.
He took an elementary course in coding.
The problem was elementary for the expert.
Elementary students enjoyed the science fair.
Her testimony helped solve the case.
The photos were testimony to their hard work.
His speech was a testimony to his faith.
The witness gave testimony during the trial.
Her book is a testimony of her journey.

back_cards.definition_en: A share or interest in something
back_cards.example_en: She has a stake in the family business.
They used a stake to secure the tent.
He put his reputation at stake for the project.
The community has a stake in the park’s future.
He raised the stakes in the poker game.

back_cards.definition_en: In an exact or accurate manner
back_cards.example_en: She followed the instructions precisely.
That’s precisely what I meant to say.
He described the event precisely to the police.
The machine was calibrated precisely for the task.
The meeting started precisely at 9 a.m.
She took a big bite of the apple.
A mosquito bit him on the arm.
The tires bit into the icy road.

back_cards.definition_en: To take the bait or be fooled
back_cards.example_en: He didn’t bite when they offered a bad deal.
The cold wind bit her cheeks.
At any given time, the store is busy.
The given instructions were clear.
Her talent was a given in the competition.
Given the circumstances, we canceled the trip.
Each team was given a task to complete.
They made a substantial profit this year.
Her contribution was substantial to the project.
The house was built with substantial materials.
He inherited a substantial amount of money.
The new law had a substantial effect on taxes.
The plan changes depending on the weather.
Her decision depends on her parents’ approval.
Success depends on hard work and luck.
The cost varies depending on the season.
The trip’s length depends on our budget.
She glanced at her watch during the meeting.
He glanced at the newspaper headlines.
She glanced at the text message on her phone.

back_cards.definition_en: To scan with a quick look
back_cards.example_en: He glanced over the report before signing it.
She glanced at the stranger passing by.
She grabbed a tissue to wipe her tears.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of cells in biology
back_cards.example_en: The doctor examined the tissue under a microscope.
The gift was wrapped in colorful tissue paper.
He used a tissue to clean his glasses.
The injury damaged the muscle tissue.
Her concentration helped her ace the test.

back_cards.definition_en: A high amount in one place
back_cards.example_en: The city has a high concentration of businesses.
Writing requires a lot of concentration.
The concentration of sugar in the drink was high.
There’s a concentration of birds near the lake.
The developer built a new app for the company.
The developer planned a new housing complex.
She’s a developer of eco-friendly materials.
The developer fixed the website’s bugs.
He’s a developer of innovative business solutions.
She found her lost keys under the couch.
He found a charity to help children.
They found a hidden cave while hiking.
She found a company that sells organic food.
The jury found the defendant guilty.
She marked her choice on the ballot.
The election used a ballot to ensure privacy.

back_cards.definition_en: A list of candidates for voting
back_cards.example_en: The ballot included three names for mayor.
They counted every ballot carefully.
The ballot decided the new school policy.
He consumed a large pizza by himself.
The car consumes a lot of fuel.
She consumed the novel in one sitting.
The fire consumed the entire forest.
Work consumed most of his time this week.
She overcame her fear of public speaking.
He overcame many obstacles to finish the race.
They overcame their grief with time.
Her team overcame the odds to win.
He was overcome with joy at the news.
The biological study focused on plant growth.
She took a biological approach to the experiment.
The disease had a biological cause.
His biological parents were unknown.
The biological clock affects sleep patterns.

back_cards.definition_en: A room for a specific purpose
back_cards.example_en: The judge entered the court chamber.
The senate met in the upper chamber.
The gun’s chamber held six bullets.
The chamber of commerce hosted the event.
The castle’s chamber was cold and dark.
She dressed similarly to her sister.
The two teams performed similarly in the game.
Similarly, the new model has the same features.
He reacted similarly to the same situation.
The cities, similarly, face traffic issues.

back_cards.definition_en: To have the courage to do something
back_cards.example_en: She dared to climb the steep mountain.
He dared his friend to jump into the lake.
I didn’t dare speak during the silence.
She dared to start her own business.
He dared to question the boss’s decision.
The developing economy attracted investors.
She works in a developing country.
The developing technology changed the industry.
The developing project needs more funds.
The developing neighborhood welcomed new residents.
The tiger prowled through the jungle.
She fought like a tiger to win the match.
The kids loved seeing the tiger at the zoo.
He’s a tiger when it comes to debates.
The tiger’s roar echoed in the forest.
The ratio of boys to girls was 2:1.
She calculated the ratio of ingredients for the recipe.
The company’s debt-to-income ratio was high.
The screen’s aspect ratio was 16:9.
The ratio of work to rest affects health.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a romantic relationship
back_cards.example_en: He wrote a poem for his lover.
She’s a lover of classical music.
The story described a secret lover.
As a book lover, she owned hundreds of novels.
He’s a lover of nature and hiking.
The company planned an expansion into new markets.

back_cards.definition_en: An increase in size or scope
back_cards.example_en: The expansion of the highway reduced traffic.
The school’s expansion included a new library.
The empire’s expansion lasted centuries.
The store’s expansion doubled its space.
She encountered an old friend at the store.
He encountered difficulties during the project.
They encountered a rare bird while hiking.
She encountered criticism for her decision.

back_cards.definition_en: To meet in a casual way
back_cards.example_en: He encountered a stranger who helped him.
She occasionally visits her hometown.
He occasionally forgets his lines in the play.
It rains occasionally in the desert.
They occasionally meet for coffee.
She occasionally checks her old emails.
Unemployment rose during the economic crisis.
She struggled with unemployment for months.
The unemployment rate dropped this year.
Unemployment forced him to move back home.
The government addressed unemployment with new policies.

back_cards.definition_en: A domesticated animal kept for companionship
back_cards.example_en: Her pet dog sleeps by her side.
Reading is her pet hobby.

back_cards.definition_en: An animal cared for at home
back_cards.example_en: The pet cat chased a laser pointer.
She called her child her little pet.
Their pet rabbit loves carrots.
The weather was awful during the trip.
The awful smell made her leave the room.
The accident was an awful tragedy.
The movie received awful reviews.
She felt awful after missing the deadline.
The scientist worked in a laboratory all day.
The laboratory developed a new vaccine.
They tested the samples in the laboratory.
The laboratory created cutting-edge technology.
The chemistry laboratory was well-equipped.
The school administrator organized the event.
She works as a hospital administrator.

back_cards.definition_en: A leader of systems or policies
back_cards.example_en: The administrator updated the company rules.
The city administrator handled the budget.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of tasks
back_cards.example_en: He’s the administrator of the online platform.
